climbs.name: Voodoo Child
climbs.fa: C Ruckgraber, S Sangdahl, J Baldwin, 1998

content.description:
"I stand up next to a mountain

And I chop it down with the edge of my hand"

Jimi Hendrix

15 years after being established, this worthwhile route still has some friable rock and a thought provoking flake.

Surmount the initial overhang, head upwards to the 3rd bolt, then rightwards under, on and over a flake that could add to the adventure. Some fun moves lead to the final headwall, which is steep, hard and sharp. This may be a little height-dependent if you are shorter than 5'6". It is a challenging onsight no matter your height.
content.protection: 8 bolts, ring and chain at anchor.
content.location:
Voodoo Child is around the corner from

Monkey Porch

and

Sufferin' Succotash

. If approaching from above, it is easier to stay on the left bank (looking down) of the gully until you can cross back on a rocky ramp, then scramble up ledges to the base of the climb. There's a bolt for the belayer, clipping in would be a very good idea if the leader has any chance of falling before clipping bolt 1 on route. The ledges are not child/dog friendly but are a much pleasanter staging area than the base near

Monkey Porch

.

content.description:
Social Justice Warrior is an excellent jug fest up the steepest part of The Wall of Voodoo, 15 feet to the left of the steep corner

Voodoo Child

.

Start up the easy slab (with a bolt) before launching up the overhanging wall. With many big moves on jugs, this route will get you pumped. The bolts are well placed, with a three bolt anchor that will get you back to the ground with one 50m rope.

Although an excellent route, this short and sweet line does have some crumbly rock. A belayer may want to consider using a helmet.

Rolofson's sport climbing guidebook to Boulder Canyon rates this route 12b/c; however, it is much easier at about 12a/b.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a 3 bolt anchor w/ rings and a chain.
content.location:
It is on the steepest part of The Wall of Voodoo, 15 feet to the left of the steep corner

Voodoo Child

.

climbs.name: Sufferin' Succotash
climbs.fa: Chip Ruckgraber, Steve Sangdahl, John Baldwin,1988

content.description:
Suffering Succotash climbs up the steep corner on the right side of The Wall of Voodoo, 15 to the right of the excellent jug fest,

Porch Monkey

, 12a/b.

Although the initial 20 feet is slightly chossy, the business on this route is steep and funky, on good rock.

Rolofson's guide gives this route a 12a/b rating; however, it is really about 5.11d.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
